title: Clay Ball colliding with block attached to ceiling

content.question: A distant planet has an acceleration due to gravity of <math alttext="4 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>4 m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math> near its surface. An object is released from rest from the top of a tall cliff on the planet, and the object lands at the bottom of the cliff in <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn></math> seconds. A second object is then thrown upward from the edge of the same cliff with a speed of <math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>4 m/s</mtext></math>. The time it takes the second object to reach the bottom of the cliff is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="19 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>19</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>
<math alttext="21 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>21</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>
<math alttext="22 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>22</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>
<math alttext="80 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="21 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>21</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
